page.title: 02KEMP TOWN AND SEA FRONT
page.content: Kemp Town is composed of Sussex Square, Lewes Crescent & Chichester/ Arundel Terraces which are all Grade One Listed, begun in 1823 to the design of Wilds & Bushy by Thomas Reid Kemp. The terraces surrounded an open area of private gardens. There are very few whole houses left, the majority having been{subdivided}into flats with prices varying from Â£70,000 to Â£150,000. There are several other squares & crescents in the area though all are much smaller & many have been recently rebuilt rather badly, others have become hotels. Some places such as Royal Crescent (1798-1807 Grade II) still maintain their original appearence faced with mathematical tiles. Other places such as Portland Place are Grade II and many have become guest houses.
